intro: Phyllanthus ridsdalei, commonly known as the Ridsdale's spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it has attracted interest in botanical research and horticulture.
